```{.r .cell-code}
install.packages("palmerpenguins")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
The following package(s) will be installed:
- palmerpenguins [0.1.1]
These packages will be installed into "~/Palmer Penguin EDA/renv/library/R-4.3/aarch64-apple-darwin20".

# Installing packages --------------------------------------------------------
- Installing palmerpenguins ...                 OK [linked from cache]
Successfully installed 1 package in 3.3 milliseconds.
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
library(palmerpenguins)
data(package = 'palmerpenguins')
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# HANDLING MISSING VALUES
sum(is.na(penguins)) #check for missing data
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 19
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
penguins <- na.omit(penguins) #omit missing data from the original dataset
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# VISUALIZATION
ggplot(penguins, aes(x = body_mass_g)) + 
  geom_histogram(bins = 30, fill = "blue", color = "white")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](eda_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(penguins, aes(x = species, y = flipper_length_mm, fill = species)) + 
  geom_boxplot()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](eda_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-2.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(penguins, aes(x = bill_length_mm, y = bill_depth_mm, color = species)) + 
  geom_point()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](eda_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-3.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# SUMMARY STATISTICS
penguins %>% 
  group_by(species) %>% 
  summarise(across(c(bill_length_mm, bill_depth_mm, flipper_length_mm, body_mass_g), mean, na.rm = TRUE))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning: There was 1 warning in `summarise()`.
ℹ In argument: `across(...)`.
ℹ In group 1: `species = Adelie`.
Caused by warning:
! The `...` argument of `across()` is deprecated as of dplyr 1.1.0.
Supply arguments directly to `.fns` through an anonymous function instead.

  # Previously
  across(a:b, mean, na.rm = TRUE)

  # Now
  across(a:b, \(x) mean(x, na.rm = TRUE))
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 3 × 5
  species   bill_length_mm bill_depth_mm flipper_length_mm body_mass_g
  <fct>              <dbl>         <dbl>             <dbl>       <dbl>
1 Adelie              38.8          18.3              190.       3706.
2 Chinstrap           48.8          18.4              196.       3733.
3 Gentoo              47.6          15.0              217.       5092.
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# CORRELATION ANALYSIS
cor_penguins <- select(penguins, bill_length_mm, bill_depth_mm, flipper_length_mm, body_mass_g)
cor(cor_penguins, use = "complete.obs")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
                  bill_length_mm bill_depth_mm flipper_length_mm body_mass_g
bill_length_mm         1.0000000    -0.2286256         0.6530956   0.5894511
bill_depth_mm         -0.2286256     1.0000000        -0.5777917  -0.4720157
flipper_length_mm      0.6530956    -0.5777917         1.0000000   0.8729789
body_mass_g            0.5894511    -0.4720157         0.8729789   1.0000000
```

:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
## LAB 3

con <- DBI::dbConnect(duckdb::duckdb(), dbdir = "my-db.duckdb")

# Optionally check if the table exists and then decide to overwrite or append
if (DBI::dbExistsTable(con, "penguins")) {
    DBI::dbWriteTable(con, "penguins", palmerpenguins::penguins, overwrite = TRUE)
} else {
    DBI::dbWriteTable(con, "penguins", palmerpenguins::penguins)
}

DBI::dbDisconnect(con)
```
:::
